result.execSummary:
The defendant William Harris Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 2, credit for 15 days.
Extended Supervision and Probation conditions the same except for condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 12/12/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge by 12/12/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No alcohol or controlled substances.
No violations of State or Federal law.

Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification program.
Court orders no drivers license suspension.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: STRAIGHT TIME, IMPOSED and STAYED, to be used at agent's discretion.
There must be a minimum of at least 10 hours per week and can be performed at any non-profit other than the defendant's own.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: To Count 1, with credit for 15 days time served.
Extended Supervision and Probation conditions the same except for condition time.

timeConds.notes: STRAIGHT TIME, IMPOSED and STAYED, to be used at agent's discretion.

Trial Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

Defendant William Harris in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by: Shawn M., Pastor Gregory Lewis, Gary G.
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 2, credit for 15 days.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS, concurrent to Count 1, credit for 15 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-6 months in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT TIME, IMPOSED and STAYED to be used bt the agent
-No violations of State or Federal law 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Complete 1000 hours of community service. there must be a minimum of at least 10 hours per week and can be performed at any non-profit other than the defendants own
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 12/12/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge by 12/12/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court orders no drivers license suspension.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

14RM049790  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
10-30-2014

Defendant William Harris in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  At the hour of 2:10 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY AS TO BOTH COUNTS which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 12/12/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis.
